channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft Corporation -- SMBv2/SMBv3
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft Corporation -- SMBv2/SMBv3

item.title: CVE-2017-0016|2024-08-05T12:47:57.579Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- smbv2%2Fsmbv3
item.description: Microsoft Windows 10 Gold, 1511, and 1607; Windows 8.1; Windows RT 8.1; Windows Server 2012 R2, and Windows Server 2016 do not properly handle certain requests in SMBv2 and SMBv3 packets, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SMBv2 or SMBv3 packet to the Server service, aka "SMBv2/SMBv3 Null Dereference Denial of Service Vulnerability."
